segment.source: Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: The MED-V workspace is a virtual machine that contains a separate operating system, whose automatic software update process must be managed just like the physical computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace is a virtual machine that contains a separate operating system, whose automatic software update process must be managed just like the physical computers in your enterprise.

segment.source: Because the guest operating system is not always necessarily running when the host operating system is running, you must ensure that the MED-V virtual machine is configured in such a way that software updates can be applied to the guest operating system as required.
segment.target: Because the guest operating system is not always necessarily running when the host operating system is running, you must ensure that the MED-V virtual machine is configured in such a way that software updates can be applied to the guest operating system as required.

segment.source: The Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 solution provides the functionality that lets you determine how automatic software updates are processed in a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 solution provides the functionality that lets you determine how automatic software updates are processed in a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Wake-Up Policy
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Wake-Up Policy

segment.source: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy guarantees that the MED-V virtual machine is made available for updates for the time that you specify in your MED-V configuration settings.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy guarantees that the MED-V virtual machine is made available for updates for the time that you specify in your MED-V configuration settings.

segment.source: This applies to both updates that are published from Microsoft through Windows Update and updates deployed and controlled by non-Microsoft solutions, such as antivirus applications.
segment.target: This applies to both updates that are published from Microsoft through Windows Update and updates deployed and controlled by non-Microsoft solutions, such as antivirus applications.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy is optimized for the Microsoft Update infrastructure.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy is optimized for the Microsoft Update infrastructure.

segment.source: If you are using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager to deploy non-Microsoft updates, we recommend that you also use the System Center Updates Publisher, which takes advantage of the same infrastructure as Microsoft Update and therefore benefits from the MED-V workspace wake-up policy.
segment.target: If you are using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager to deploy non-Microsoft updates, we recommend that you also use the System Center Updates Publisher, which takes advantage of the same infrastructure as Microsoft Update and therefore benefits from the MED-V workspace wake-up policy.

segment.source: For more information, see System Center Updates Publisher (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200035).
segment.target: For more information, see System Center Updates Publisher (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200035).

segment.source: When you created your MED-V workspace package, you configured when and how it starts, either when the end user logs on (Fast Start) or when the end user first opens a published application (Normal Start).
segment.target: When you created your MED-V workspace package, you configured when and how it starts, either when the end user logs on (Fast Start) or when the end user first opens a published application (Normal Start).

segment.source: Or you set the option to let the end user control this setting.
segment.target: Or you set the option to let the end user control this setting.

segment.source: Either way, whenever the Fast Start option is selected, the virtual machine continues to run as long as the MED-V host is logged on as User.
segment.target: Either way, whenever the Fast Start option is selected, the virtual machine continues to run as long as the MED-V host is logged on as User.

segment.source: In this configuration, because MED-V is active when the host is active, automatic updates are applied without requiring any extra processing from MED-V.
segment.target: In this configuration, because MED-V is active when the host is active, automatic updates are applied without requiring any extra processing from MED-V.

segment.source: However, for those cases in which Fast Start is not specified or the virtual machine hibernates or stops, MED-V guarantees through its MED-V workspace wake-up policy that the guest operating system is being regularly updated even when MED-V is not used regularly.
segment.target: However, for those cases in which Fast Start is not specified or the virtual machine hibernates or stops, MED-V guarantees through its MED-V workspace wake-up policy that the guest operating system is being regularly updated even when MED-V is not used regularly.

segment.source: MED-V performs this function by regularly waking up the virtual machine based on the configuration settings that you specify.
segment.target: MED-V performs this function by regularly waking up the virtual machine based on the configuration settings that you specify.

segment.source: This enables the automatic update clients in the virtual machine to execute based on their configurations.
segment.target: This enables the automatic update clients in the virtual machine to execute based on their configurations.

segment.source: After the time period defined by the MED-V configuration setting elapses, MED-V returns the virtual machine to its previous state.
segment.target: After the time period defined by the MED-V configuration setting elapses, MED-V returns the virtual machine to its previous state.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the end user opens a published application during the update period, the required updates are applied, but MED-V is not automatically hibernated or shut down after the update period ends.
segment.target: If the end user opens a published application during the update period, the required updates are applied, but MED-V is not automatically hibernated or shut down after the update period ends.

segment.source: Instead, MED-V continues running.
segment.target: Instead, MED-V continues running.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy includes three main components:
segment.target: The MED-V workspace wake-up policy includes three main components:

segment.source: Guest Update Manager
segment.target: Guest Update Manager

segment.source: Residing on the MED-V host, this stand-alone executable program is responsible for waking up the virtual machine according to a predefined, configurable schedule.
segment.target: Residing on the MED-V host, this stand-alone executable program is responsible for waking up the virtual machine according to a predefined, configurable schedule.

segment.source: Specify the configuration settings to indicate at what time the update manager should wake up the virtual machine every day, and how long the virtual machine should be kept awake (in minutes) to allow for updates to be applied.
segment.target: Specify the configuration settings to indicate at what time the update manager should wake up the virtual machine every day, and how long the virtual machine should be kept awake (in minutes) to allow for updates to be applied.

segment.source: After the number of minutes specified has been reached, the guest update manager puts the virtual machine into hibernation, prepared for the next use.
segment.target: After the number of minutes specified has been reached, the guest update manager puts the virtual machine into hibernation, prepared for the next use.

segment.source: You can schedule the execution of this executable program through the Windows Task Manager.
segment.target: You can schedule the execution of this executable program through the Windows Task Manager.

segment.source: Guest Restart Management Service
segment.target: Guest Restart Management Service

segment.source: Residing on the MED-V host, this service has three primary responsibilities.
segment.target: Residing on the MED-V host, this service has three primary responsibilities.

segment.source: Along with the Guest Update Manager, it manages the restart of the virtual machine at user logon, if it is required.
segment.target: Along with the Guest Update Manager, it manages the restart of the virtual machine at user logon, if it is required.

segment.source: It detects when virtual machine restarts are required caused by updates being installed.
segment.target: It detects when virtual machine restarts are required caused by updates being installed.

segment.source: And it ensures that the task for the Guest Update Manager is always scheduled according to configuration.
segment.target: And it ensures that the task for the Guest Update Manager is always scheduled according to configuration.

segment.source: Guest Update Service
segment.target: Guest Update Service

segment.source: Residing on the MED-V virtual machine, this Windows service has the responsibility of monitoring when installed updates require a restart.
segment.target: Residing on the MED-V virtual machine, this Windows service has the responsibility of monitoring when installed updates require a restart.

segment.source: After the service becomes aware of the need for a restart, it notifies the guest restart management service on the host.
segment.target: After the service becomes aware of the need for a restart, it notifies the guest restart management service on the host.

segment.source: Configuration Settings for MED-V Workspace Wake-Up Policy
segment.target: Configuration Settings for MED-V Workspace Wake-Up Policy

segment.source: You control when and for how long the virtual machine awakens to receive automatic updates by defining the following two configuration values in the registry.
segment.target: You control when and for how long the virtual machine awakens to receive automatic updates by defining the following two configuration values in the registry.

segment.source: Both of these values are located under the HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMEDVv2VM key.
segment.target: Both of these values are located under the HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMEDVv2VM key.

segment.source: GuestUpdateTime – Configures the hour and minute each day when MED-V must wake up the virtual machine for updating, based on the 24-hour clock standard.
segment.target: GuestUpdateTime – Configures the hour and minute each day when MED-V must wake up the virtual machine for updating, based on the 24-hour clock standard.

segment.source: Specify the time in the format HH:MM.
segment.target: Specify the time in the format HH:MM.

segment.source: The default value is 00:00 (midnight).
segment.target: The default value is 00:00 (midnight).

segment.source: GuestUpdateDuration – Configures the number of minutes that MED-V must keep the virtual machine awake for updating, starting at the time specified in the GuestUpdateTime configuration setting.
segment.target: GuestUpdateDuration – Configures the number of minutes that MED-V must keep the virtual machine awake for updating, starting at the time specified in the GuestUpdateTime configuration setting.

segment.source: The default value is 240 (4 hours).
segment.target: The default value is 240 (4 hours).

segment.source: Setting this value to zero (0) disables the MED-V workspace wake-up policy.
segment.target: Setting this value to zero (0) disables the MED-V workspace wake-up policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to define your MED-V configuration values, see Managing MED-V Workspace Configuration Settings.
segment.target: For more information about how to define your MED-V configuration values, see Managing MED-V Workspace Configuration Settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A MED-V best practice is to set your wake up interval to match the time when MED-V virtual machines are planned to be updated regularly.
segment.target: A MED-V best practice is to set your wake up interval to match the time when MED-V virtual machines are planned to be updated regularly.

segment.source: In addition, we recommend that you configure these settings to resemble the host computer’s behavior.
segment.target: In addition, we recommend that you configure these settings to resemble the host computer’s behavior.
